intro: Flabellaria paniculata, commonly known as the panicle-flowered flabellaria, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Pacific. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers that bloom in panicles. It typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
